definition: a member of the same clan/a distant relative with the same family name
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
capitalist

sentences.english: Union was a tool used by the capitalists in their vain attempt to damp down the labour movement.
sentences.chinese: 那個黃色工會是資本家妄圖用來撲滅工人運動的工具。

sentences.english: I don't want anyone with factories or prostitutes or concubines.
sentences.chinese: 我不找資本家，也不要逛窯子或有小老婆的人。

sentences.english: Many students now anathematise "Bologna" as a capitalist plot.
sentences.chinese: 如今許多學生咒罵“博洛尼亞”是資本家的陰謀。

sentences.english: Arnie has just presented his business plan to Sabine, a venture capitalist.
sentences.chinese: 艾爾尼剛把他的商業計劃書交給風險資本家薩比娜。

sentences.english: "I consider myself a capitalist, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “我把自己定位成資本家，”他說。

sentences.english: Capitalists use laborers' surplus value to make a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 資本家利用勞工的剩餘價值發家致富。

sentences.english: Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫要把贖罪祭的公牛牽來宰了，爲自己和本家贖罪。

sentences.english: That is the money capitalists, a couple of students recipients closure report letter.
sentences.chinese: 即資本家出點錢，受助學生出幾封報告信。

sentences.english: Following the seizure of capital goods, young Chiang turned to arrest the capitalists themselves.
sentences.chinese: 搶走了人家的資產以後，小蔣又進而逮捕資本家本人。

sentences.english: Venture capitalists are right to warn entrepreneurs of getting caught with their pants singed.
sentences.chinese: 風投資本家警告創業者勿“引火燒身”，這是對的。

sentences.english: So join us at the Qwest for our annual Woodstock for Capitalists.
sentences.chinese: 中心參與資本家的伍斯達克年度音樂會。

sentences.english: My maternal grandfather is a capitalist, who is a famous "furrier" in the Tianjin bazaar.
sentences.chinese: 外祖父是資本家，是天津勸業場有名的“皮貨商”。

sentences.english: Another section lurking in the anti-Japanese camp would also like to cross over.
sentences.chinese: 再一部分資本家，躲在抗日陣線內的，也想跑去。

sentences.english: But all venture capitalists should have to disclose their personal failure rates.
sentences.chinese: 但是所有的風險資本家必須坦白他們的失敗率。

sentences.english: The international capitalists dictate and the nation’s sovereignty becomes a sham.
sentences.chinese: 這樣國際資本家擁有支配權，而國家主權淪爲傀儡。

sentences.english: As is known to the world, capitalists are tireless in hunting for super profit.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，資本家對超額利潤的追求總是不知疲乏的。

definition: (orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
Your Highness/Your Majesty
counselor of king or feudal warlord/henchman
Tokugawa, the ruling clan of Japan from 1550-1850
princely
fence/hedge/screen/barrier/vassal state/Taiwan pr. [fan2]
wife's parents' home
ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
father's younger brother/uncle
head of a household
to inform/to notify
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. for 大方之家[da4 fang1 zhi1 jia1]
Northeast China/Manchuria/lit. east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1]/Kantō region of Japan
relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
father-in-law (wife's father)
